# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = split(s, " ")
    wrapped_lines = []
    for line in lines
        if length(line) > text_width
            wrapped_lines = vcat(wrapped_lines, wrap(line, text_width))
        else
            wrapped_lines = vcat(wrapped_lines, [line])
        end
    end
    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end
```
This function takes an `AbstractString` as input and returns a wrapped version of the string with each line having at most `text_width` characters. The default value for `text_width` is 10.

Example:
```
julia> s = "This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped to fit within a certain width.";

julia> wrap_string(s)
"This is a very
long sentence that
should be wrapped to
fit within a certain
width."

julia> wrap_string(s, 5)
"This
is a
very
long
sentence
that
should be
wrapped
to fit within
a certain
width."
```
